intro: Culcita, commonly known as the rock cress, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its low-growing, herbaceous structure and small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or yellow. The plant has a fibrous root system and is often found growing in rocky or sandy soils. Culcita species are typically perennial and can be found in temperate regions across the Northern Hemisphere. They are known for their ability to thrive in harsh environments, making them resilient and adaptable plants.
